intro: Nesaea ondongana var. evansiana, commonly known as the Evans' nesaea, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows as a low shrub with woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with a deep root system to access groundwater. The flowers bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
